item.title: Python
item.description: library(reticulate) Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON="/usr/bin/python") use_python("/usr/bin/python") Python can be used to filter out important information using regular expressions. I created a list of birthdays for 7 different people. import re string_bdays=" David: 09.06.62, Aida: 09.22.65, Brian: 03.22.87, Wendy: 06.03.89, Dorian: 10.18.2006, Sabastian: 07.19.09, Sergio: 12.02.97, Alisha: 06.11.98" print(string_bdays) #Here I filtered out all of the birthdays ## David: 09.06.62, Aida: 09.22.65, Brian: 03.22.87, Wendy: 06.03.89, Dorian: 10.18.2006, Sabastian: 07.19.09, Sergio: 12.02.97, Alisha: 06.

item.title: Project 1 by Annmarie Calderon
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Project 2
item.description: R Markdown 0. In this project, I use the dataset called Melanoma. In this dataset, there are 205 observations of patients tdiagnosed with melanoma and information regarding their condition. There are a total of 7 variables: survival time since their operation, status (whether they are still alive or have passed away), sex, age, year of their operation, thickness of their tumor, and lastly, a binary variable indicating the presence of a tumor.
